page.title: 03FOREST AND FIELD
page.content: Two types of landscape prevail in this area - forest and field. The North West is covered with pine forest, its verges planted with a variety of deciduous trees which provide both interest and contrast to the massed conifers. There are several large clearings where the timber has been felled and old roots piled into wind breaks to shelter the newly planted saplings. Immediately outside the afforested area the landscpae becomes that of fairly large fields, mostly used for the growing of arable crops, divided by low hedges and fringed with shrubs and trees that are reminders of the more old fashioned hedgerows.
